sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
In the figure given below, it is given that \(NO \parallel LM \). If the area of triangle KNO is 49 cm\(^2\), area of trapezium NLMO is 312 cm\(^2\), and it is also given that \(LM = 13 \) cm, then find the length of NO .
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "$$\text{ 
Since it is given that $NO \parallel LM $, we can write that}$$
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}\input[s1v3]{} = \angle KLM 
\]
\[
	\angle KON = \angle KML 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
So, we can write that
\[
	\Delta \input[s2v1]{}\input[s2v2]{}\input[s2v3]{} \sim \Delta KLM 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 4, "step_txt": "
We can write that
\[
	\textrm{area of } \Delta KLM = \textrm{area of } \Delta \input[s3v1]{}\input[s3v2]{}\input[s3v3]{} + \textrm{area of trapezium } NLMO 
\]
\[
	= 49 + 312 = \input[s3v4]{} \textrm{ cm}^2
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Now, we can write
\[
	\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta KNO }{\textrm{area of }\Delta KLM } = \frac{\input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{} ^2 }{LM ^2}
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{49 }{361 } = \left(\frac{NO }{LM }\right)^2
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{NO }{LM } = \frac{\input[s5v1]{} }{19.0 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow NO = 13 \times \frac{7.0 }{19.0 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow NO = \input[s5v2]{} \textrm{ cm}
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["K", "N", "O"], "text": "$$\text{Since, $NO \parallel LM $, therefore, $\angle KNO = \angle KLM$, and $\angle KON = \angle KML$, as corresponding angles for parallel lines are equal.}$$"}, {"data": ["K", "N", "O"], "text": "$$\text{Due to angle-angle similarity, we can write $\Delta KNO \sim \Delta KLM$}$$"}, {"data": ["K", "N", "O", 361], "text": "$${$\textrm{area of } \Delta KLM = \textrm{area of } \Delta KNO + \textrm{area of trapezium } NLMO$ (From the figure), and putting corresponding values, we get
	$\textrm{area of } \Delta KLM = \textrm{area of } \Delta KNO + \textrm{area of trapezium } NLMO = 361 \textrm{ cm}^2$ }$$"}, {"data": ["N", "O"], "text": "$$\text{Since, the ratio of the area of similar tiangles is equal to the raio of the square of the corresponding sides, therefore, $\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta KNO }{\textrm{area of }\Delta KLM } = \frac{NO ^2 }{LM ^2}$}$$ "}, {"data": [7.0, 4.79], "text": "$$\text{Upon further simplification, we get $NO = 4.79 \textrm{ cm}$}$$"}]
